description:
Resizing table columns with touch.

BUG=
TEST=Manual test.

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=142934

messages.text:
Some nits:

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode77
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:77: * Starts the dragging of the splitter. Adds listeners for mouse move and
Please update the comment to mention touch.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode172
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:172: * to a splitter starts gragging.
typo: gragging

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode210
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:210: * Rectangular area around the splitters sensitive to touch events
I suggest adding the word "WIDTH" somewhere in the comment and perhaps in the variable. Area that equals 30 is a bit confusing.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode77
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:77: * Starts the dragging of the splitter. Adds listeners for mouse move and
On 2012/05/29 14:58:22, Vladislav Kaznacheev wrote:
> Please update the comment to mention touch.

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode172
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:172: * to a splitter starts gragging.
On 2012/05/29 14:58:22, Vladislav Kaznacheev wrote:
> typo: gragging

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode210
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:210: * Rectangular area around the splitters sensitive to touch events
On 2012/05/29 14:58:22, Vladislav Kaznacheev wrote:
> I suggest adding the word "WIDTH" somewhere in the comment and perhaps in the
> variable. Area that equals 30 is a bit confusing.

Done.

ping

Erik, please, review this CL.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode71
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:71: false);
Why? It is better to use bubbling when possible.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode80
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:80: *                           started the drag.
strange indentation

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
The reason this and endDrag were public and took an event was that it allows someone to initiate the drag. I guess we do not use this so it is fine to make this changes. We should probably make startDrag private too then?

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
can you rename to isTouch or isTouchEvent?

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode140
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:140: if (e.touches.length == 1) {
Why? Can' we allow the user to resize two splitters at the same time :-)

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode143
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:143: // Default action is to start selection and to move focus.
This comment is not correct any more. Please update.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode169
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:169: * @param {number} clientX X position of the mouse or touch event.
@private

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode197
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:197: e.stopPropagation();
stopPropagation needs a comment

http://codereview.chromium.org/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode198
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:198: e.preventDefault();
preventDefault needs a comment

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode71
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:71: false);
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> Why? It is better to use bubbling when possible.

Reverted.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode80
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:80: *                           started the drag.
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> strange indentation

Fixed.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> The reason this and endDrag were public and took an event was that it allows
> someone to initiate the drag. I guess we do not use this so it is fine to make
> this changes. We should probably make startDrag private too then?

It still is true. I initiate drag from TableHeader. It is because I want to have touch sensitive area much larger than mouse sensitive one.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> can you rename to isTouch or isTouchEvent?

Done.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode140
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:140: if (e.touches.length == 1) {
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> Why? Can' we allow the user to resize two splitters at the same time :-)

It's for start. Lets' file an issue to support reasonable amount of simultaneous drags. I guess 20 will be enough :-)

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode143
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:143: // Default action is to start selection and to move focus.
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> This comment is not correct any more. Please update.

Commented.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode169
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:169: * @param {number} clientX X position of the mouse or touch event.
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> @private

Done.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode197
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:197: e.stopPropagation();
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> stopPropagation needs a comment

Done.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode198
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:198: e.preventDefault();
On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> preventDefault needs a comment

Done.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
On 2012/06/15 13:44:36, SeRya wrote:
> On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> > The reason this and endDrag were public and took an event was that it allows
> > someone to initiate the drag. I guess we do not use this so it is fine to make
> > this changes. We should probably make startDrag private too then?
> 
> It still is true. I initiate drag from TableHeader. It is because I want to have
> touch sensitive area much larger than mouse sensitive one.

This could have been achieved with checking the type of the event. Now every caller has to do this.

I'm fine with this even though I slightly would have preferred passing in (MouseEvent|TouchEvent)

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode102
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:102: // Another mousedown (other mouse button clicked or we somehow
This should never happen.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode153
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:153: // We goting to handle this touch. It shouldn't be translated
What does goting mean? =P

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode206
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:206: handleTouchEnd_: function(e) {
Can we remove handleMouseUp_, handleTouchEnd_ and handleTouchCancel_ and just use endDrag_ as the event handler?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode63
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:63: this.placeSplitters_(this.querySelectorAll('.table-header-splitter'));
This change seems unrelated.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode128
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:128: * @param {Array.<HTMLElement>} splitters Array of splitters.
Not really an Array. It is a static NodeList

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode130
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:130: placeSplitters_: function(splitters) {
This seems unrelated

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode210
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:210: // We goting to handle this touch. It shouldn't be translated
goting again?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
It could indeed. However I feed that code gets more clear if receives parameters that it going to use directly rather than receiving a generic parameter and extracting that values in different ways depending on actual type.

On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> On 2012/06/15 13:44:36, SeRya wrote:
> > On 2012/06/13 19:33:52, arv wrote:
> > > The reason this and endDrag were public and took an event was that it allows
> > > someone to initiate the drag. I guess we do not use this so it is fine to
> make
> > > this changes. We should probably make startDrag private too then?
> > 
> > It still is true. I initiate drag from TableHeader. It is because I want to
> have
> > touch sensitive area much larger than mouse sensitive one.
> 
> This could have been achieved with checking the type of the event. Now every
> caller has to do this.
> 
> I'm fine with this even though I slightly would have preferred passing in
> (MouseEvent|TouchEvent)

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode102
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:102: // Another mousedown (other mouse button clicked or we somehow
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This should never happen.

Removed.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode153
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:153: // We goting to handle this touch. It shouldn't be translated
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> What does goting mean? =P

It was unnecessary. Removed.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode206
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:206: handleTouchEnd_: function(e) {
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> Can we remove handleMouseUp_, handleTouchEnd_ and handleTouchCancel_ and just
> use endDrag_ as the event handler?

Done.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode63
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:63: this.placeSplitters_(this.querySelectorAll('.table-header-splitter'));
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This change seems unrelated.

It is related change. While recreating splitters on fly works fine with mouse events there are sporadic troubles with touch dragging. Apparently it is because touch is bound to a DOM node. If the node removed form the tree the touch stops.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode128
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:128: * @param {Array.<HTMLElement>} splitters Array of splitters.
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> Not really an Array. It is a static NodeList
It actually both.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode130
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:130: placeSplitters_: function(splitters) {
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This seems unrelated

Related (as described above).

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/11001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode210
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:210: // We goting to handle this touch. It shouldn't be translated
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> goting again?

Removed.

LGTM

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/7001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js#newcode83
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/splitter.js:83: startDrag: function(clientX, touch) {
On 2012/06/16 14:13:08, SeRya wrote:
> It could indeed. However I feed that code gets more clear if receives parameters
> that it going to use directly rather than receiving a generic parameter and
> extracting that values in different ways depending on actual type.

Fair enough. My concern was that the caller needs to know a lot more than desired and it might lead to duplicate code.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/20001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js
File chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10459007/diff/20001/chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js#newcode192
chrome/browser/resources/shared/js/cr/ui/table/table_header.js:192: var candidate = null;
no need to assign null here

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/serya@chromium.org/10459007/22001

Try job failure for 10459007-22001 (retry) on win_rel for step "chrome_frame_net_tests".
It's a second try, previously, step "chrome_frame_net_tests" failed.

subject: Resizing table columns with touch.
